instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the analysis of protein species?
Output: Surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) was used in the related study.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the machine learning classification approach for discriminating between protein species with closely resembled spectral profiles?
Output: PCA and t-SNE spectral feature processing methods were used in the machine learning classification approach for discriminating between protein species with closely resembled spectral profiles.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the success of the discrimination of proteins using the proposed approach in the analysis of protein species?
Output: The Mahalanobis distance (MW) metric was chosen to evaluate the success of the discrimination of proteins using the proposed approach in the analysis of protein species.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the proposed approach for discriminating between protein species with similar spectral profiles in surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) analysis?
Output: PCA was used in the proposed approach for discriminating between protein species with similar spectral profiles in surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) analysis.

instruction: Can the proposed method of machine learning classification combined with PCA and multipeak fitting be used to analyze spectral data in surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) for biological and biomedical research purposes?
Output: Yes, the proposed method of machine learning classification combined with PCA and multipeak fitting can be used to analyze spectral data in surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) for biological and biomedical research purposes. This method allows for the effective classification of protein species with closely resembled spectral profiles and also provides a thorough characterization of the chemostructural differences among them. By utilizing this approach, it is possible to achieve successful discrimination of proteins and explore new routes for SERS evolution towards sensing applications and diagnostics in the field of life sciences.
